alert.note: Alert for Sanilac; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sanilac and northeastern St. Clair Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Peck, or 9 miles north of Yale, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Croswell and Applegate around 320 PM EDT. Lexington around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Birch Beach, Blaine, Jeddo, Lexington Heights, Fargo, Roseburg, Amador and Valley Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
